name: siger
description: A traditional golden crown from Lampung, worn by brides during weddings.

name: kembang goyang
description: A delicate floral hairpin with dangling ornaments, often worn in Javanese and Sundanese traditions.

name: tusuk konde
description: An ornate hairpin used to secure a bun (konde), common in Javanese bridal hairstyles.

name: gelang kana
description: A thick, rigid bracelet from Bali, often made of gold or silver with intricate carvings.

name: gelang rantai
description: A chain-style bracelet, sometimes adorned with charms or gemstones.

name: cincin batu akik
description: A ring set with 'batu akik' (agate stone), believed to have mystical properties.

name: subang
description: Traditional Javanese earrings, often gold with floral or teardrop designs.

name: anting panjang
description: Long, dangling earrings worn in Minangkabau and Malay traditions.

name: kalung pending
description: A choker-style necklace with a central clasp, common in Balinese jewelry.

name: kalung ulu
description: A multi-layered necklace from Sumatra, often made of silver or gold coins.

name: gelang kaki
description: An anklet worn by dancers in traditional Indonesian performances.

name: ikat pinggang
description: A decorative waistband or belt, often woven with gold or silver thread.
